column1: The Naples city council requested the Italian government's permission to rename the stadium after Diego Maradona
column2: who helped Napoli win Serie A titles in 1987 and 1990 and remains a popular figure in Naples — despite the Italian law prohibiting the naming of a  public building after someone dead less than ten years.

column1: The stadium was one of the venues of the 1990 FIFA World Cup
column2: and held five matches. The first two were Argentina’s Group B matches: the first was against Soviet Union on June 13 winning 2-0
column3: and the second was against Romania on June 18 ending in a 1-1 draw. The next two were Cameroon matches: the first was a Round of 16 match against Colombia on June 23 winning 2-1 after extra time
column4: and the second was a Quarter-finals match against England on July 1 losing 3-2 after extra time. The fifth and last was the Semi-final between Argentina and hosts Italy on July 3
column5: with Argentina winning 4-3 on penalties after drawing 1-1 in the extra time.
